taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek dasy- , thick- or dense-, and lirion , white lily, alluding to the compact arrangement of flowers in the inflorescence]

bio:treatment.discussion: Dasylirion was once a major food source in the desert southwest. The bulbs were roasted in rock-lined pits and pounded into cakes. A potent alcoholic beverage, known as “sotol,” is distilled from the baked and fermented bulbs. Leaves of Dasylirion are widely used to weave baskets.
